p: These results suggest that the stembark extract of L. sericeus possesses anti-inflammatory and analgesic activities and these data validate its use in ethnomedicine for management of inflammation and pains. The high LD 50 (i.p.) confirms the very low toxicity level of the stembark decoction of L. sericeus. The administration (i.p.) of the stembark decoction of L. sericeus at these dose regimes is therefore not expected to produce harmful results.
